subject: Learning
title: Open Educational Resources
description: A micro-lesson that makes Open Educational Resources usable.

hook.text: MIT put all its course materials online for free in 2001. Over 300 million people have used them since.

buildup.text: Open Educational Resources are teaching materials anyone can freely use, adapt, and redistribute.

discovery.text: OER reduces textbook costsâ€”which average $1,200 per year for US college studentsâ€”to zero.

twist.text: Studies show OER produces equal or better outcomes compared to expensive commercial textbooks.

climax.text: From OpenStax to Wikipedia, free knowledge is reshaping who gets to learn and what it costs.

punchline.text: Knowledge wants to be free. OER is making that literal.

quiz.question: What are Open Educational Resources?
